alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 4:10PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CALHOUN...SOUTHEASTERN ETOWAH... NORTH CENTRAL CLEBURNE AND SOUTHERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM CST... At 410 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Neely Henry Lake to near Ohatchee to near Munford. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Anniston, Oxford, Jacksonville, Rainbow City, Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Heflin, Cobb Town, West End-Cobb Town, Fort McClellan, Saks, Glencoe, Weaver, Ohatchee, Hobson City, Edwardsville, Tennala, Pleasant Gap, and Blue Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
